John Samples has written a piece on National Review Online which opines that Michael Moore's film Farenheit 9/11 may be in violation of McCain/Feingold campaign finance laws if the film is advertised and shown 60 days before the Republican National Convention or the general election. Whatever one thinks of the film (and I don't think much of it to say the least) this is an illustration of the absurdity of the law. I know many people have supported McCain/Feingold to get the money out of politics but it is having a chilling effect as it clearly violates the 1st Amendment. I think this is as good an oppurtunity as any to voice our displeasure at congress and the President for making this rediculous law.
